div0.head: *y
div0.entryFree:
*y y, yei= (q. v.), to/, indecl., twenty-third letter of the Ionic alphabet, Pl. Cra. 427a , Callias ap. Ath. 10.453d : not used in the Attic alphabet: in the Western Gr. alphabets it represents the sound x (
kh): with the value
ps it is found in SIG 1 (Nubia, vi B. C.), etc.: as a numberal, y/ =
700 , but y'
=
700 , 000 .
y y repeated, as exclamation, S. Ichn. 170 .

ya/gda_n, a_nos, or sa/gdas, o(, an Egyptian
unguent; the following forms are found: *ai)gupti/w| ya/gdani tri\s leloume/nh
Eub. 102
; fe/r' i)/dw, ti/ soi dw= tw=n mu/rwn; ya/gdan filei=s;
Ar. Fr. 206
; sa/gdan e)rugga/nonta
Eup. 198
; ba/kkari/s te kai\ sa/gdas o(mou=
Epil. 1
: ya/da| (sic codd.) is cited by Erot. fr. Hp. (not found in codd. Hp. ), and fr. Eup. ( Fr. 198 ?): nom. yagdhs (unaccented) Ath. 15.690e , cf. yagdh=s, Hsch. (Egypt.
sgnn with or without prefixed masc. Art.
p;).

ya/gios [a^], a, on,
oblique, askew, metaph.,
mal à propos, blundering, ei) pa\r me/los e)/rxomai ya/gion (sic codd. vett.) o)/aron e)nne/pwn
Pi. N. 7.69
: ya/gion: pla/gion, loco/n, e)pikeklime/non,
Hsch. ; ya/dion: ka/tantes, Id.

ya/dda: h( kina/baris, Id. yaduro/s,
v. yaquro/s.
yae/nai: fqa/sai, kti/sai, Id.

ya^qa/llw,
scratch, rub, su\ de\ th\n kefalh\n ya/qalle/ mou
scratch my head, Hermipp. 78 , cf. Pl.Com. 59 .

yaqaro/s,
v. yaquro/s.

ya/qea: ywmi/a,
Hsch. (yaqe/a cod.).

ya^qoplo/kos, o(,
= yiaqoplo/kos , Sammelb. 5124.332
(ii A. D.).

ya^qu/rion [u^], to/,
= yw/qion , Ath. 14.646c .

ya^qu^ro/omai, Pass. ,
crumble away,
Aq. Jo. 9.5(11) , Ps. 101(102).4 .

ya^qu^ro/s, o/n,
friable, crumbling, of the roe in fish, Arist. HA 510b26 ; i)xqu=s . . tou\s sarkw/deis kai\ y.
Diocl.Fr. 141
; opp. gli/sxros,
Arist. Mete. 387a15 ; of bread, Gal. 6.523 ; of cheese, opp. kollw/dhs, ib. 698 ( Comp. ); of meat, Ruf. ap. Orib. 4.2.8 ( Comp. ); to\ u(/dwr y.
Arist. Sens. 441a25
; of air, Id. de An. 419b35 ; of earth, Thphr. CP 2.4.11 , Nic. Al. 145 ; gh= -wte/ra
Gp. 3.3.10
; of the texture of some bulbs, Thphr. HP 7.9.4 ; of leaves in a salad, Hp. Liqu. 5 ( Comp. ); also yaduro/n: a)sqene/s, madaro/n, yaquro/n,
Hsch. (the form is Att. acc. to Gal. 16.760 ), and yaqara/: eu)/qlasta, etc., Hsch. ; cf. yafaro/s.

ya^qu^ro/ths, htos, h(,
looseness of consistency,
Arist. HA 524b26 , Pr. 928a10 , Gal. 6.799 .

yaidra/: a)raio/trixa,
Hsch. : yaidro/n: faidro/n, . . , Id. ( Cypr. acc. to Et.Gud. 572.53 ). yaiqo/n: u(pofoini/sson,
Hsch.
yaika/zei: r(a<i/>nei, Id. (yak- poscit ordo). yai/kalon: e)/mbruon, bre/fos, Id. (leg. yak-).
yaikalou=xon: e)/mbruon, Id. yai=ma: o)li/gon Id.; cf. yai=sma.
yainou/zein: dia\ r(.pismou= katayu/xein. ga\r de\ kai\ drapismou=, Id. (Fort. yainuqi/zein: dia\ r(ipismou= k., gr(a/fetai) de\ kai\ dia\ prismou= katayh/xein.)

yainu/qios, on,
false, vain,
Hsch. :— Lyc. 1420 has yai/nunqa qespi/zein prophesy
falsely (formed like mi/nunqa ).

yainu=ntes: ywmi/zontes,
Hsch.
yai/nuon: a)xrei=on, Id. yainu/roito: diesei/sato, Id. yai/nusma: o)li/gon, Id.; cf. yai=sma.
yainu/ssein: r(<i>pi/zein, Id.

yai/rw, only pres., and not in Att. Prose: (v. ya/w): trans.,
graze, brush lightly, touch gently, oi)=mon ai)qe/ros yai/rei pteroi=s . . oi)wno/s
is ready to skim the path of ether, A. Pr. 396 ;
rub, scrape gently in washing, Eun. VS p.486B.
intr.,
move lightly or
quiver, flutter, palpitate, of an irregular pulse and the like , Hp. Mul. 2.120 : hence,
rustle, murmur, of the
rustling of leaves in the breeze, Luc. Trag. 315 ; of stars,
twinkle,
Nic. Th. 123 .
yai/rein le/gomen to\ i(sti/on o(/tan e)lafrw=s diapne/htai
Hsch.
s.v. diayai/rousi.

yai=sma: si=ton o)li/gon,
Hsch. , cf. yai=ma, yai/nusma.

yaist-i/on, Dim. of
yaisto/n,
AP 5.16 ( Gaet. ), dub. in IG 5(1).1447 (Messene, iii/ii B. C.).

yaist-o/s, h/, o/n, (yai/w)
ground, y. ma=za a cake
of ground barley mixed with honey and oil, Hp. Int. 20 ; yaisto/n, to/ (sc. pe/mma or po/panon), a
cake of this kind, used at sacrifices, Ar. Pl. 138 , 1115 , Antiph. 206.3 , Com.Adesp. 372 , Thphr. ap. Porph. Abst. 2.15 , SIG 1038.18 (Eleusis, iv/iii B. C.), Herod. 4.92 , AP 6.190 ( Gaet. ), 191 ( Corn. Long.): perh. to be written ya|sto/s, cf. ya=|ston: su\n tw=| i_, e)ktei/nousi to\ a_, w(s *eu)fro/nios,
Lex.Mess. p.411 : v. yasth/s.

yaist-w/dhs, es,
like a yaisto/n,
AB 313 .

yai/stwr, oros, o(,
one that wipes off,
spo/ggos
AP 6.295
( Phan. ).

yai/w,
= ya/w (q. v.),
rub away, grind down, in aor. 1
Med. , Thphr. ap. Porph. Abst. 2.6 :—aor.
Pass. , ibid.

ya^ka/dion, later yeka/dion, to/, Dim. of
yaka/s,
drizzle,
Polioch. 2.5 , Thphr. CP 2.9.3 .

ya^ka/d-issa [a^d], h(,
spotted, dappled, of a mare, prob. in PPetr. 2p.115
(ii B. C.).

ya^kad-isxi/ois (dat. pl.),
with dappled haunches(?), of horses, ibid.

ya^ka/zw, later yeka/zw, (yaka/s):—
rain in small drops, drizzle, drip,
Ar. Nu. 580 : impers., yaka/zei
it drizzles, yakaze/tw a)/rtoisi
let it rain loaves, Nicoph. 13 :— Med. , ei)ka/zousi . . lu/xnw| yakazome/nw| mu/wpa they like n a short-sighted person to a
spluttering (i. e. dying) lamp, prob. in Arist. Rh. 1413a4 (cf. Anon. in Rh. 217.3 ; ei)s mu/wpa codd., ei)s secl. Buhle):— Pass. , yekasqe/nta
moistened with slight rain,
Thphr. CP 6.19.5
.

ya/ka^lon [a^], to/,
new-born animal,
Ar.Byz. ap. Eust. 1625.48 ; ya/kalos, o(, Id. ap. Ael. NA 7.47 : yai/kalon in cod. Hsch. (From yaka/s; for the sense cf. dro/sos, e(/rsh.)

ya^ka^lou=xos, on, (e)/xw)
having young, mhte/res y. mothers
with their young,
S. Fr. 793 (anap.); cf. yaikalou=xon.

ya^ka/s, Ion. and later (cf. Moer. p.419 P.) yeka/s, a/dos , h(:—
drop of rain,
o(/tan me\n kata\ mikra\ fe/rhtai, yaka/des, o(/tan de\ kata\ mei/zw mo/ria, u(eto\s kalei=tai
Arist. Mete. 347a11
, cf. 348a7 , al.;
particle, ib. 373b16 : mostly collect.,
drizzle, yaka\s de\ lh/gei, i. e. heavy rain (o)/mbros) is coming, A. Ag. 1534 (lyr.); opp. u(etoi/,
X. Cyn. 5.4 (pl.); u(/sqhsan ai( *qh=bai yaka/di
Hdt. 3.10
: generally,
rain,
u(po\ ste/gh| puknh=s a)kou=sai yaka/dos
S. Fr. 636
, cf. E. Hel. 2 , Ar. Th. 856 ; so yeka/s
Hp. Epid. 2.3.1 : yeka/des
showers,
Gal. 17(1).37
; also foi/nissa yaka/s
a shower of blood, Simon. 106 ; ba/llei m' e)remnh=| yaka/di foini/as dro/sou
A. Ag. 1390
; *bromi/ou yaka/dessi, i. e.
drops of wine, Critias 1.10 . Comic name for
a sputterer,
Ar. Ach. 1150 (lyr.), cf. Suid.
s.v.
metaph. of solids, a)rguri/ou mhde\ yaka/s not a
drop of money, Ar. Pax 121 ; [ya/mmou] yeka/s
grains of sand, AP 12.145 . (yaka/s prob. by assimilation from yeka/s.)

ya^kasto/s, h/, o/n,
dripping,
mu/ron
Ephipp. 26
.

ya/kelon: me/ga,
Hsch. (cod. me/sa), Suid.

ya/kion [a^], to/, Dim. of
yaka/s,
small piece or
drop,
Hsch.
ya/kta, h(, a kind of
cake, Id. yakth/r, h=ros, o(, = yh/ktra , Id. (perh. for *yhkth/r).
yala/qrion, dub. l. in AP 7.472.11 ( Leon. ).

ya^la/kanqa [a^k], h(, name of a fabulous plant, Eub. 28 (hex.), Ptol.
Heph. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.150B. (Ptol.Cyther., Suid. ).

yala/kios, o(, perh. an occupational name, dub. in PLond. 3.604.40
(i A. D.).

ya^lakto/s, h/, o/n,
to be touched, dub. in Hsch. ; cf. a)ya/laktos.

ya^la/ssw, later Att.
ya^ka/d-ttw,
like ya/llw, yaqa/llw ,
touch lightly,
Ael. NA 3.18 ; y. ktu/pon neura=s make a string sound
by touching it, Lyc. 139 :—aor. 1
Med. in Hsch.

ya^li/dion [i^d], to/,
pair of scissors,
POxy. 1289.5 , 6
(v A. D.). as pr. name,
Scissors, nickname of Alexander Logotheta, because he
clipped the coins, Procop. Arc. 26 , Goth. 3.1 .

ya^li^do-eidh/s, e/s, (
yali/s
11
)
like a vault or
arch,
Ph. Bel. 81.35 , Gal. UP 8.11 .

ya^li^do/-stomos, on,
nipper-mouthed, Com. epith. of crabs, Batr. 295 .

ya^li^d-o/w, (
yali/s
11
)
vault, arch,
Bito 54.7 ( Pass. ).

ya^li^/d-wma, atos, to/,
vault, CIG 4385 (Isauria, ii A. D.); y. kamarwta/
Str. 16.1.5
, cf. Gloss.

ya^li^d-wto/s, h/, o/n,
arched, vaulted,
i(ppafe/seis
D.H. 3.68
.

ya^l-i/zw, fut.
-i/cw
Anacreont. 9.4
: (yali/s):—
clip with scissors, l. c., Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.10 , Antyll. ap. eund. 7.21.6 ; to\n mallo\n e)ya/lizen
Babr. 51.4
, cf. Aesop. 382b : yali/cai: kei=rai,
Hsch.

ya^/l-ion, to/, part of the bridle,
curb-chain,
r(utagwge/a . . e)k tou= y. h)rthme/non
X. Eq. 7.1
; to\ peri\ ge/neion dieiro/menon, ya/lion
Poll. 1.148
; = kri/kos tou= xalinou= , Sch. E. Ph. 792 : freq. in pl., because
the curb-chain was formed of links, which rattled as the horse moved, xrusoxa/linon pa/tagon yali/wn
Ar. Pax 155
(anap.); yali/wn kro/ton kai\ xalinou= ktu/pon
Ael. NA 6.10
; yali/ois e)da/mase pw/lous
E. HF 381
(lyr.): metaph., oi(=on y. au)th=| [th=| basilei/a|] e)ne/bale th\n tw=n *)efo/rwn du/namin
Pl. Lg. 692a
. generally,
chain, bond,
A. Pr. 54 (pl.): metaph., me/ga d' a)fh|re/qh y. oi)ketw=n
Id. Ch. 962
(lyr.).
borinou= kai\ notinou= yali/ou (or *yali/ou) the N. and S.
ring (or Ring), in description of an estate, POxy. 1632.12
(iv A. D.). a horse's
jaw,
Hippiatr. 28 (cf. ye/lion, ya/llion).

ya^l-i/s, i/dos, h(,
a pair of scissors, among the toilette articles of a lady, Ar. Fr. 320.1 , S. Fr. 413 (nisi leg. ye/lia), PTeb. 331.13
(ii A. D.); drepa/noisi kai\ ou) yali/dessi karh=nai
AP 11.368
(Jul.Antecessor).
razor, expld. by mia=| maxai/ra| (v. ma/xaira), Poll. 2.32 , 10.140 .
sewer, drain,
stenh\n d' e)/dumen yali/da
S. Fr. 367
;
vault, crypt,
yali/dapromh/kh li/qwn poti/mwn
Pl. Lg. 947d
;
barrel-vault,
Supp.Epigr. 2.582 (Ionia, iii/ii B. C.),
Explor.Arch. de Délos
11.262 , Ph. Bel. 80.46 (pl.), Hero
*Stereom.
2.28 ; a)nh/geiren th\ny. tau/thn
Supp.Epigr. 2.755
(Syria, ii A. D.); Gal. compares the
fornix (yalidoeide/s) of the brain to a y. oi)kodomh/matos sfairoeidou=s,
2.725 ; similarly the
arch of the foot, UP 3.8 ; having keystones (o)mfaloi/), Arist. Mu. 399b30 ; and being curved (kamfqei=sa), Str. 17.1.42 (dub.), D.S. 2.9 ; expld. by kama/ra and a(yi/s, Sch. Pl. l. c., Suid. ; as entrance and exit of a theatre, LW 1586 (Aphrodisias, written yeli/s).
ai( y. tw=n stu/lwn prob. the
rounded mouldings between the capital and the column, LXX Ex. 27.10 , 11 ; so perh. yalli/des in BGU 1028.9
(ii A. D.). pl.,
rings for the staves of the altar of incense, LXX Ex. 30.4 ;
iron bands for strengthening an engine, Ph. Bel. 57.33 .
= taxei=a ki/nhsis , Sch. Pl. Lg. 947d .

ya^l-ismo/s, o(,
clipping,
Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2 .
5 .

ya^l-iste/on,
one must clip,
Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.10 .

ya^l-isto/s, h/, o/n,
clipped, Hierocl. p.54A. , Antyll. ap. Orib. 8.5.1 , Aët. 3.129 .

yallhgenh/s, e/s, (ya/llw)
sprung from harp-playing, Com. epith. of Archytas, strictly a parody of Homer's moirhgenh/s,
Bion ap. D.L. 4.52 .

ya/llion, to/,
= ya/lion , prob.
chain,
PLond. 3.1177.234
(ii A. D.).

yalli/s,
v. yali/s
111 .

ya/llw, fut.
ya^lw=
LXX Jd. 5.3
, 1 Ep.Cor. 14.15 : aor.
e)/yhla
Pl. Ly. 209b
, etc., and in LXX
e)/ya_la
Ps. 9.12
, al.:—
pluck, pull, twitch, y. e)/qeiran
pluck the hair, A. Pers. 1062 : esp. of the bow-string, to/cwn xeri\ ya/llousi neura/s
twang them, E. Ba. 784 ; keno\n kro/ton
Lyc. 1453
; e)k ke/raos y. be/los
send a shaft
twanging from the bow, APl. 4.211 (Stat. Flacc.); so miltoxarh\s sxoi=nos yallome/nh a carpenter's red line, which
is twitched and then suddenly let go, so as to leave a mark, AP 6.103 ( Phil. ): metaph., gunai=kas e)c a)ndrw=n yo/gos ya/llei, keno\n to/ceuma
E. Fr. 499
. mostly of the strings of musical instruments,
play a stringed instrument
with the fingers, and not with the plectron, yh=lai kai\ krou/ein tw=| plh/ktrw|
Pl.
l. c., et ibi Sch.; e)a/n tis yh/las th\n nh/thn e)pila/bh|
Arist. Pr. 919b15
; mousikw/tatos w)\n xata\ xei=ra di/xa plh/ktrou e)/yalle
Ath. 4.183d
; opp. kiqari/zw,
Hdt. 1.155 , SIG 578.18 (Teos, ii B. C.); pri\n me/n s' e(pta/tonon ya/llon (sc. th\n lu/ran) Ion Eleg. 3.3 : abs., Hdt. l. c., Ar. Eq. 522 , Hippias (?) in PHib. 1.13.24 ; ko/rais
Men. Epit. 260
; ya/llein [ou)k e)/ni] a)/neu lu/ras
Luc. Par. 17
:—Prov., r(a=|on h)/ tis a)\n xordh\n yh/leie 'as easy as falling off a log', Aristid. Or. 26(14).31 . later,
sing to a harp,
LXX Ps. 7.18 , 9.12 , al.; th=| kardi/a|
Ep.Eph. 5.19
; tw=| pneu/mati 1 Ep.Cor. l. c.
Pass. , of the instrument,
to be struck or
played,
yallome/nh xordh/
Arist. Pr. 919b2
; also of persons,
to be played to on the harp,
Macho ap. Ath. 8.348f .
